description.zh-cn: 以《古兰经》为基础，圣训为辅助的一神教宗教，世界三大宗教之一。
description.en: A monotheistic religion based on the Quran, supplemented by the Hadith, and one of the three major world religions.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教的根本经典，穆斯林相信其为造物主逐字逐句的启示。
description.en: The foundational scripture of Islam, believed by Muslims to be a word-for-word revelation from God.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教先知穆罕默德的言行录，是伊斯兰教教义、律例、礼仪的第二重要渊源。
description.en: The records of the sayings and actions of the Islamic prophet Muhammad, serving as the second most important source of Islamic doctrine, law, and practice.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教的最后一位先知，被穆斯林认为是“众先知的封印”。
description.en: The final prophet of Islam, considered by Muslims to be the 'Seal of the Prophets'.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教信仰的独一且无与伦比的造物主。
description.en: The one and incomparable Creator believed in by Islam.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教中的天使，负责向先知穆罕默德传达真主的启示。
description.en: An angel in Islam responsible for delivering God's revelations to the prophet Muhammad.

description.zh-cn: 穆罕默德去世后由其继承人（哈里发）领导的伊斯兰政教合一的政治实体。
description.en: The politico-religious state comprising the Muslim community and its lands and subjects, ruled by a caliph after Muhammad's death.

description.zh-cn: 一个由土耳其人建立的帝国，其扩张促进了伊斯兰教的传播，也是最后一个哈里发国。
description.en: An empire founded by Turkish tribes whose expansion facilitated the spread of Islam and which was the last caliphate.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教最大的教派，占穆斯林总数的75%至90%。
description.en: The largest denomination of Islam, comprising 75% to 90% of all Muslims.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教第二大宗派，占穆斯林总数的10%至20%。
description.en: The second largest denomination of Islam, comprising 10% to 20% of all Muslims.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教的神秘主义、苦修层面，通过个人体验寻求对真主的爱戴和认识。
description.en: The mystical, ascetic dimension of Islam, which seeks to find the love and knowledge of God through direct personal experience.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教的首任哈里发，四大哈里发之一。
description.en: The first Caliph of Islam and one of the Four Rightly Guided Caliphs.

description.zh-cn: 奥斯曼·本·阿凡遇刺后爆发的内战，导致了伊斯兰教逊尼派和什叶派的分裂。
description.en: A civil war that broke out after the assassination of Uthman ibn Affan, leading to the split between Sunni and Shia Islam.

description.zh-cn: 穆罕默德的堂弟和女婿，第四任哈里发，被什叶派尊为第一任伊玛目。
description.en: Muhammad's cousin and son-in-law, the fourth Caliph, revered by Shia Muslims as the first Imam.

description.zh-cn: 倭马亚王朝的创建者和第一任哈里发。
description.en: The founder and first caliph of the Umayyad Caliphate.

description.zh-cn: 第一个世袭的伊斯兰哈里发王朝。
description.en: The first hereditary Islamic caliphate.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教早期出现的教派，因反对阿里·本·阿比·塔利卜的统治而分裂出来。
description.en: An early Islamic sect that emerged by splitting from the rule of Ali ibn Abi Talib.

description.zh-cn: 推翻倭马亚王朝后建立的第二个伊斯兰哈里发王朝。
description.en: The second Islamic caliphate, established after overthrowing the Umayyad Caliphate.

description.zh-cn: 13世纪由成吉思汗建立的帝国，其西征灭亡了阿拔斯王朝。
description.en: An empire founded by Genghis Khan in the 13th century, whose westward expansion led to the fall of the Abbasid Caliphate.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性的战争，导致了奥斯曼帝国的瓦解。
description.en: A global war that led to the collapse of the Ottoman Empire.

nodes.id: 穆罕默德·伊本·阿卜杜·瓦哈布

zh-cn: 穆罕默德·伊本·阿卜杜·瓦哈布

description.zh-cn: 18世纪在沙特阿拉伯推动赛莱菲复兴运动的伊斯兰学者，瓦哈比派的创始人。
description.en: An 18th-century Islamic scholar in Saudi Arabia who promoted the Salafi revival movement; the founder of Wahhabism.

description.zh-cn: 逊尼派的一种极端保守改革运动，致力于净化伊斯兰教，革除后世的创新。
description.en: An ultra-conservative reform movement within Sunni Islam dedicated to purifying Islam by eliminating later innovations.

description.zh-cn: 中国的一场政治运动，期间许多清真寺被关闭，宗教活动被禁止。
description.en: A political movement in China during which many mosques were closed and religious activities were banned.

description.zh-cn: 柬埔寨的共产主义政权，因其仇视宗教的政策而杀害了大量占族穆斯林。
description.en: The communist regime in Cambodia, which killed a large number of Cham Muslims due to its policy of hostility towards all religions.

description.zh-cn: 分布于柬埔寨和越南的一个民族，其中许多人信奉伊斯兰教。
description.en: An ethnic group distributed in Cambodia and Vietnam, many of whom practice Islam.

description.zh-cn: 基地组织的创始人和领导人。
description.en: Founder and leader of Al-Qaeda.

description.zh-cn: 一个跨国的伊斯兰极端主义组织，诉诸恐怖主义以反抗西方影响。
description.en: A transnational militant Islamist organization that resorts to terrorism to resist Western influence.

description.zh-cn: 由基地组织发动的系列恐怖袭击事件，导致了伊斯兰恐惧症的弥漫。
description.en: A series of terrorist attacks launched by Al-Qaeda, which led to the spread of Islamophobia.

description.zh-cn: 对伊斯兰教或穆斯林的恐惧、憎恨或偏见，是一种社会现象。
description.en: Fear, hatred of, or prejudice against the religion of Islam or Muslims in general, a social phenomenon.

description.zh-cn: 一个致力于促进穆斯林国家之间全面合作的国际组织。
description.en: An international organization dedicated to promoting comprehensive cooperation among Muslim countries.

nodes.id: 阿克萨清真寺纵火事件

zh-cn: 阿克萨清真寺纵火事件

description.zh-cn: 1969年发生在耶路撒冷阿克萨清真寺的纵火事件，促成了伊斯兰合作组织的成立。
description.en: An arson attack that occurred at the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem in 1969, which prompted the establishment of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation.

description.zh-cn: 一位早期的基督教神学家，曾撰文从神学角度批判伊斯兰教。
description.en: An early Christian theologian who wrote theological critiques of Islam.

description.zh-cn: 德国神学家和宗教改革家，曾批判《古兰经》。
description.en: A German theologian and religious reformer who criticized the Quran.

description.zh-cn: 穆斯林相信《古兰经》是安拉（真主）通过天使加百列向穆罕默德逐字逐句传达的启示。
description.en: Muslims believe the Quran is the literal word of Allah (God) as revealed to Muhammad through the angel Gabriel.

description.zh-cn: 天使加百列向穆罕默德传达了真主的启示，这些启示后来被编纂成《古兰经》。
description.en: The angel Gabriel delivered God's revelations to Muhammad, which were later compiled into the Quran.

description.zh-cn: 伊斯兰教是以《古兰经》为根本基础的宗教。
description.en: Islam is a religion fundamentally based on the Quran.

description.zh-cn: 圣训是伊斯兰教教义、律例和礼仪的重要辅助渊源。
description.en: The Hadith serves as an important supplementary source for Islamic doctrine, law, and practice.

description.zh-cn: 穆罕默德作为最后一位先知，向人们传道，恳请他们崇拜唯一的真主，从而传播了伊斯兰教。
description.en: As the final prophet, Muhammad preached to people, urging them to worship the one God, thereby spreading Islam.

description.zh-cn: 奥斯曼帝国的扩张使伊斯兰教从麦加向大西洋及太平洋的方向扩散。
description.en: The expansion of the Ottoman Empire caused Islam to spread from Mecca towards the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

description.zh-cn: 关于宗教及政治领导权的争端引发了第一次穆斯林内战，并最终导致了逊尼派的形成。
description.en: Disputes over religious and political leadership triggered the First Fitna, which ultimately led to the formation of Sunni Islam.

description.zh-cn: 关于宗教及政治领导权的争端引发了第一次穆斯林内战，并最终导致了什叶派的形成。
description.en: Disputes over religious and political leadership triggered the First Fitna, which ultimately led to the formation of Shia Islam.

description.zh-cn: 阿里·本·阿比·塔利卜在661年被哈瓦立及派刺杀。
description.en: Ali ibn Abi Talib was assassinated by the Kharijites in 661.

description.zh-cn: 在阿里被刺杀后，穆阿威叶一世掌权并创建了倭马亚王朝。
description.en: After Ali's assassination, Muawiyah I took power and founded the Umayyad dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 阿拔斯王朝在750年推翻了倭马亚王朝的统治。
description.en: The Abbasid Caliphate overthrew the Umayyad Caliphate in 750.

description.zh-cn: 蒙古帝国在1258年攻陷巴格达，灭亡了阿拔斯王朝。
description.en: The Mongol Empire destroyed the Abbasid Caliphate by sacking Baghdad in 1258.

description.zh-cn: 奥斯曼帝国在第一次世界大战后瓦解。
description.en: The Ottoman Empire collapsed after World War I.

description.zh-cn: 随着奥斯曼帝国的瓦解，哈里发制度在1924年被废除。
description.en: With the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, the Caliphate was abolished in 1924.

relationships.source: 穆罕默德·伊本·阿卜杜·瓦哈布

description.zh-cn: 穆罕默德·伊本·阿卜杜·瓦哈布推动了赛莱菲（瓦哈比）复兴运动。
description.en: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab promoted the Salafi (Wahhabi) revival movement.

description.zh-cn: 在中国文化大革命期间，许多清真寺被关闭，伊斯兰教的宗教活动被禁止。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution in China, many mosques were closed and Islamic religious activities were banned.

description.zh-cn: 红色高棉政权在其统治期间杀害了约15万占族穆斯林。
description.en: The Khmer Rouge regime killed approximately 150,000 Cham Muslims during its rule.

description.zh-cn: 奥萨玛·宾·拉登是基地组织的创始人。
description.en: Osama bin Laden was the founder of Al-Qaeda.

description.zh-cn: 九一一袭击事件导致了全球范围内伊斯兰恐惧症的弥漫和加剧。
description.en: The September 11 attacks led to the spread and intensification of Islamophobia worldwide.

relationships.source: 阿克萨清真寺纵火事件

description.zh-cn: 1969年耶路撒冷阿克萨清真寺的纵火事件促使伊斯兰合作组织的成立。
description.en: The 1969 arson attack on the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem prompted the establishment of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation.

description.zh-cn: 大马士革的圣约翰从神学角度批判伊斯兰教，认为其不合理且先知穆罕默德的声称是疯狂和胡言。
description.en: John of Damascus criticized Islam from a theological perspective, viewing it as irrational and the claims of the prophet Muhammad as madness and nonsense.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德形容穆斯林深信“《古兰经》的谎话连篇”。
description.en: Martin Luther described Muslims as deeply believing in the 'pack of lies in the Quran'.

description.zh-cn: 在第一次穆斯林内战期间，阿里·本·阿比·塔利卜与穆阿威叶一世是敌对势力的领导人。
description.en: During the First Fitna, Ali ibn Abi Talib and Muawiyah I were leaders of opposing forces.

description.zh-cn: 逊尼派认为首四任哈里发（以阿布·伯克尔为首）是穆罕默德的正统继任人。
description.en: Sunnis consider the first four caliphs, starting with Abu Bakr, to be the rightful successors to Muhammad.

description.zh-cn: 什叶派相信穆罕默德指定了他的女婿阿里·本·阿比·塔利卜作为他的继承人，并认为只有阿里的后裔才能成为伊玛目。
description.en: Shias believe that Muhammad appointed his son-in-law Ali ibn Abi Talib as his successor and that only Ali's descendants can be Imams.
